artifact.art_title: The system must provide for the possibility for third-party expansion of the system.
The system must record the patient.
The system must provide the ability to update data if the patient is in the system.
The system must record the admission, including the initial diagnosis.
The system must have a patient waiting list.
The system must support the request for an interpreter for the arrival time.
The system must allow a case to be transferred to someone else.
The system must allow acess to the state of the patient.
The system must provide an overview of planned services and results.
The system must provide access to the entire medication pattern of the patient.
The system must calculate the medication dose.
The system must allow the entry of a diagnosis code.
The system must allow all changes to the diagnosis to be recorded.
The system must allow earlier versions of diagnosis to be kept.
The diagnosis code must be either NHC code, ICPC code or a temporary code.
The system must record the state of the diagnosis to be either considered, valid, or outdated.
The system must limit the text in the diagnosis description field to be no more than one or two lines.
The system must allow checks to be printed on preprinted forms.
The system must be able to show an overview and forecast of the bed occupation.
The system must contain a report generator that is easy to use.
The system must be able to show all reports on the screen as well as on print.
The system must give customer rights to use the tools and extract the data stored in the system.
The system must use NHC data that is reasonably recent.
The system can allow IT support to roll NHC data back to the previous version.
The system can allow data for a single patient to be transferred on the user's request.
The system can periodically transfer data from the new system.
The system must identify the user.
The system must time out if the user has been away from the system for some time.
The system must require a password only if the system has been logged out automatically.
The system must check that only authorized users have access to systems and data.
The systems must require each user to have only one user name and one password.
The system must provide security management the ability to assign or remove access rights for a user.
The system must provide security management the ability to create a user.
The system must assign each user to one or more roles.
The system must enable each role to have one or more rights.
The system must allow the creation of new role types with new combinations of rights.
The system must provide an overview of who has which rights and whether some rights have not been assigned to anyone.
The system must protect against the loss or replication of data transferred between two systems.
The system must protect against concurrency problems.
The system must protect against a disk crash.
The system must protect against a fire.
The system must protect unintended user actions from causing the system to close down, neither on the client nor on the server.
The system must check all data for format, consistency and validity.
The system must warn the user if format, consistency or validity are in doubt.
The system must allow the user to correct mistakes easily.
The system must provide the user with the ability to interrupt long functions.
The system must protect against unauthorized persons obtaining manager rights through the internet.
The system must protect against wire-tapping of passwords.
The system must protect against unauthorized persons from getting access to personal data.
The system must require error messages to be understandable and helpful.
The system must be designed to operate the system with keyboard only.
The system must be designed so users can learn the system on their own.
The system must require the user interface to follow MS-Windows guidelines.
The system must require web pages to be suited for screen readers.
The system must require the user interface to follow MS-Windows guidelines.
The system must require the user interface to be in Danish.
The system must require the pages with opening hours, phone numbers, and addresses to be available in Danish, English, Turkish and Urdu.
The system must require the pages to follow the HTML guidelines for Accessibility.
The system must measure reponse times regularly.
The system must not slow down the user's typing speed when moving from one field to the next.
The system must ensure data is visible and typing is possible when moving from one screen to the next.
The system must allow selections from a drop-down list to be available within the mental switching time.
The system must require reports used frequently to be visible within the mental switching time.
The system must require reports occassionally used to be visible within a certain amount of time.
The system must transfer data from external systems within a certain amount of time.
The system must log a user into the system within a certain amount of time.
